content: OK, It's done, the northern koreans just joined the nuclear family of boom-boom.and the rest of the nuclear family has not fired a shot at them because they know as well as the rest of us that they will not be the only nation that will test their nuclear metal in this crazy topsy turvey world. So where do we go from here or what do we do to the Koreans? do we bomb them back to the stone age? or do we impose economical sanctions on them like in Cuba?.have you seen the life of the north koreans locals?....look, none of these things are going to work in these political climates, nor do we have the (WILL POWER) to start another war, America nor the rest of the world for that matter want to go to war against anybody, the north koreans made their move when they knew the world was (NOT) in the mood for more war of any calible. Now, we are waiting for the north koreans to act responsible with this new power they have unleased....JUST REMEMBER, BECAREFULL OF WHAT YOU ASK FOR...BECAUSE YOU JUST MAY GET IT.....and now that you have it...you're playing with the big boys, Good Luck!!!

content: Like a dog chasing a car, once you got it, what are you going to do with it? Especially if all the other puppies have one. I think we've gone beyond non-proliferation. Every country should be able to choose nuclear, or non-nuclear - just like neutrality. There ain't no sense having nuclear weapons unless you're willing to use them. The old Las Alamos debate is back.
reply: Like a dog chasing a car, once you got it, what are you going to do with it? Especially if all the other puppies have one. I think we've gone beyond non-proliferation. Every country should be able to choose nuclear, or non-nuclear - just like neutrality. There ain't no sense having nuclear weapons unless you're willing to use them. The old Las Alamos debate is back.
